BOEING: American aerospace manufacturer founded 1916 by William Boeing. Commercial airplanes: 737, 747, 777, 787. Blue logo. Defense, space systems. 737 MAX crisis. Competes with Airbus. Largest aerospace exporter. Seattle area headquarters.
TOMTOM: Dutch navigation company founded 1991. GPS devices popularized 2000s. Smartphone apps challenged business. Maps, traffic data licensing. Live traffic services. Fleet management. B2B pivot. Autonomous vehicle mapping. Location technology provider.
RICOH: Japanese imaging company founded 1936. Copiers, printers, cameras. Pentax cameras acquired 2011. Office equipment focus. Theta 360 cameras. Document management solutions. Multifunction printers. Major copier manufacturer competing with Canon, Xerox.
GARNIER: French beauty brand founded 1904 by Alfred Amour Garnier. L'Oréal owns since 1965. Fructis haircare. Naturals skincare. Nutrisse hair color. Accessible prestige beauty. Green sustainable focus. Available in 120+ countries. Mass-market leader.
ALDO: Canadian footwear retailer founded 1972 by Aldo Bensadoun. Affordable fashion shoes and accessories. Yellow shopping bags. International expansion. Mr. B's division. 3,000+ stores at peak. Declining with e-commerce competition.
WORDPRESS: Open-source content management system released 2003 by Matt Mullenweg and Mike Little. Powers 40%+ of websites. Automattic company provides WordPress.com hosting. Plugins, themes ecosystem. Gutenberg editor. Democratized web publishing globally.
FORD: American automaker founded 1903 by Henry Ford. Model T revolutionized manufacturing. Blue oval logo. F-150 bestselling US truck. Mustang iconic. Assembly line innovator. Family-controlled. 'Built Ford Tough' slogan. Major global automobile manufacturer.
GRANTS: Scottish whisky founded 1887 by William Grant. Triangular bottle distinctive. Family-owned Grant's. Glenfiddich sister brand. Blended Scotch. Popular in UK, global markets. 'Stand Fast' motto. Major blended whisky brand.
WNBA: Women's National Basketball Association founded 1996. NBA sister league. 12 teams. Summer season. Lisa Leslie, Diana Taurasi stars. Growing popularity. Social justice advocacy. Commissioner Cathy Engelbert. Premier women's basketball league.
FANTA: Orange soda created 1940 in Nazi Germany as Coke substitute. Coca-Cola brand globally from 1955. Fruity flavors. Blue and orange branding variations. Second-oldest Coke brand. Popular in Europe, worldwide. Playful youth marketing.
BURTON: American snowboard company founded 1977 by Jake Burton Carpenter. Pioneered snowboarding industry. Boards, boots, bindings. X-Games presence. Resort relationships built sport. Family-owned until 2019. Snowboarding culture icon and industry leader.
ROCHE: Swiss pharmaceutical giant founded 1896 by Fritz Hoffmann-La Roche. Valium, Tamiflu, Herceptin developed. Diagnostics leader. COVID-19 tests. Genentech subsidiary. Basel headquarters. One of largest biotech companies. Oncology, immunology focus.
BAILEYS: Irish cream liqueur created 1974 by Tom Jago for Gilbeys. Combines Irish whiskey and cream. Diageo owns. Holiday drink association. Bestselling liqueur globally. Chocolate, caramel variants. Over 130 million bottles annually.
HEINZ: American food company founded 1869 by Henry Heinz. Ketchup iconic since 1876. '57 Varieties' slogan. Kraft merged 2015 forming Kraft Heinz. Beans in UK popular. Keystone logo. Berkshire Hathaway and 3G Capital own.
PIONEER: Japanese electronics founded 1938. Car audio, home audio specialist. LaserDisc format pioneer. DJ equipment. Plasma TV early adopter. Onkyo merged with car audio 2020. Once innovative consumer electronics leader.
SANDISK: American data storage founded 1988. Flash memory pioneer. USB drives, SD cards, SSDs. Cruzer brand. Western Digital acquired 2016 for $19 billion. Embedded storage solutions. Consumer storage leader before acquisition.
DKNY: Donna Karan New York fashion founded 1984 by Donna Karan. Urban sophistication. Apple logo parody. Diffusion line from Donna Karan brand. G-III Apparel owns since 2016. Contemporary fashion, fragrances. New York City inspiration.
STIHL: German chainsaw manufacturer founded 1926 by Andreas Stihl. Orange branding. World's bestselling chainsaw brand. Two-stroke engines. Trimmers, blowers. Family-owned. Professional forestry equipment. 'Number one worldwide' slogan. Dealer-only sales model.
CROCS: American footwear founded 2002. Foam clog shoes. Love/hate polarizing design. Jibbitz charms. Comfort focus. Post Malone, Justin Bieber collaborations. Pandemic sales surge. Stock volatile. Casual comfort footwear niche.
JEEP: American automobile brand born 1941 for military. Willys MB vehicle. Seven-slot grille iconic. Wrangler, Cherokee, Grand Cherokee models. Off-road capability heritage. Stellantis owns. 'Go anywhere, do anything' ethos. Adventure lifestyle brand.
ELEVEN: 7-Eleven convenience store founded 1927 as Southland Ice. Name from original 7am-11pm hours. Slurpee frozen drink. Japanese Seven & I Holdings owns. 24-hour stores. Over 77,000 locations worldwide. Largest convenience chain globally.
GUESS: American fashion brand founded 1981 by Marciano brothers. Question mark logo. Denim, casual wear. Supermodel campaigns. Triangle logo. Licensees for accessories, fragrances. Los Angeles heritage. Affordable premium fashion positioning.
MSN: Microsoft Network launched 1995. Web portal. Hotmail email service. Messenger instant messaging (discontinued 2014). News aggregation. Rebranded multiple times. Once major web portal competing with Yahoo, AOL. News, lifestyle content currently.
ORACLE: American software corporation founded 1977 by Larry Ellison and partners. Database software pioneer. Cloud applications. Acquired Sun Microsystems, PeopleSoft, NetSuite. Red logo. Enterprise software leader. Competes with SAP. Major cloud provider.
HASBRO: American toy company founded 1923 as Hassenfeld Brothers. Transformers, G.I. Joe, My Little Pony, Nerf. Board games: Monopoly, Scrabble. Magic: The Gathering. Second-largest toymaker. Acquired eOne. Entertainment focus expanding.
FLICKR: Photo sharing platform founded 2004 by Stewart Butterfield and Caterina Fake. Yahoo acquired 2005. SmugMug acquired 2018. Pro photographer community. 1TB free storage initially. Declining against Instagram. Photography enthusiast niche.
IMDB: Internet Movie Database founded 1990 by Col Needham. Movie, TV, celebrity information. Amazon acquired 1998. Yellow logo. User ratings influential. IMDbPro subscription. Comprehensive entertainment database. 'Top 250' films list iconic.
DOLBY: American audio technology founded 1965 by Ray Dolby. Noise reduction systems. Dolby Surround, Atmos. Double-D logo. Cinema audio standard. Licensing business model. Digital+ icon on devices. Transformed audio quality in entertainment.
BACARDI: Cuban rum founded 1862 by Facundo Bacardí. Bat logo represents good fortune. Fled Cuba 1960. Family-owned largest privately-held spirits. White rum leader. Mojito association. Bacardí Limited Bermuda-based. Global rum market leader.
JANSPORT: American backpack brand founded 1967 by Murray Pletz, Skip Yowell, Jan Lewis (namesake). Outdoor gear, school backpacks. Lifetime warranty. VF Corporation owns. Right Pack style classic. Durable daypacks. Gen X nostalgia brand.
CHRYSLER: American automaker founded 1925 by Walter Chrysler. Pentastar logo. Forward Look design 1950s. Minivan inventor. Daimler merged 1998-2007. Fiat 2009. Now Stellantis. 300 sedan. Struggled maintaining relevance.
BRAUN: German consumer products founded 1921. Electric shavers, kitchen appliances, thermometers. Dieter Rams design legacy influenced Apple. Procter & Gamble acquired 1967. Sold to De'Longhi 2012. Minimalist functional design philosophy.
NICKELODEON: American kids TV channel launched 1979. Orange splat logo. Slime. SpongeBob, Rugrats, iCarly shows. Nick Jr. preschool block. Kids' Choice Awards. Paramount Global owns. Dominated children's cable television 1990s-2000s.
CAMEL: Cigarette brand introduced 1913 by R.J. Reynolds. Dromedary camel logo. Joe Camel cartoon mascot controversial 1990s. Turkish and domestic blend. Once bestselling US cigarette. Now Reynolds American (BAT) brand.
DAWN: Dish soap by Procter & Gamble since 1973. Wildlife rescue use after oil spills. 'Takes grease out of your way'. Blue Dawn original. Fairy brand equivalent internationally. Phosphate-free formulas. Leading US dish detergent.
MARTINI: Italian vermouth brand established 1863. Martini & Rossi. Cocktail association though different origin. Racing sponsorships (Williams F1). Bacardí owns. Asti sparkling wine. Red triangle logo. Aperitif and cocktail ingredient staple.
ROC: Skincare brand founded 1957 by pharmacist Jean-Charles Lissarrague. Retinol anti-aging products. Dermatologist recommended. Johnson & Johnson owned, sold to Gryphon 2017. European pharmacy brand. Clinical efficacy focus. Affordable anti-aging.
WIMBLEDON: Tennis Championships oldest tournament founded 1877. All England Club. Grass courts. White clothing rule. Strawberries and cream. Royal patronage. Middle Sunday tradition (now plays). Fourth Grand Slam. British summer institution.
PARKERPEN: American luxury pen manufacturer founded 1888 by George Parker. Duofold, Jotter models. Quink ink. British manufacturing later. Newell Brands owns. Premium writing instruments. 'Make your mark' slogan. Status symbol pens.
GMC: General Motors Truck Company founded 1912. Professional grade trucks, SUVs. Sierra pickups, Yukon SUVs. Red GMC lettering. Commercial vehicles. Slightly upscale from Chevrolet. Hummer EV revival. General Motors division.
AEGON: Dutch insurance company founded 1983 from mergers. Name from Greek god. Operates Americas, Europe, Asia. Life insurance, pensions focus. Acquired Transamerica. Blue triangle logo. Major international insurance group.
YALE: American lock manufacturer founded 1840 by Linus Yale Sr. Cylinder pin tumbler lock invented. Iconic locks. Swedish Assa Abloy owns. University separate entity. 'Yale Security' branding. Residential, commercial locks leader.
GANT: American clothing brand founded 1949 by Bernard Gantmacher. Preppy Ivy League style. Button-down shirts. Rugger shield logo. Swedish company owns since 1990s. Premium casual wear. 'American Sportswear' positioning.
NOKIA: Finnish telecommunications founded 1865 as pulp mill. Became mobile phone giant 1990s-2000s. 3310 phone legendary. Market leader pre-iPhone. Microsoft acquired, failed. Network infrastructure focus now. Comeback attempts. Iconic ringtone.
BENQ: Taiwanese electronics founded 1984. Split from Acer 2001. Monitors, projectors, digital lifestyle products. 'Bringing Enjoyment N Quality'. Acquired Siemens mobile failed. Gaming monitors BenQ Zowie. Display technology specialist.
HYATT: American hotel chain founded 1957 by Jay Pritzker. Name from Hyatt von Dehn. Regency brand. World of Hyatt loyalty. Operates 1,000+ properties. Upscale to luxury positioning. Acquisitions expanding portfolio. Major hospitality company.
SAP: German enterprise software founded 1972. Systems Applications and Products. ERP software leader. HANA database. Cloud transition. Blue logo. Competes with Oracle. Walldorf headquarters. Largest European tech company. Business software giant.
DAIMLER: German automotive corporation founded 1926. Mercedes-Benz parent. Three-pointed star. Renamed Mercedes-Benz Group 2022. Trucks separate (Daimler Truck). Gottlieb Daimler co-founder namesake. Premium vehicles, commercial vehicles. Stuttgart-based.
DUNHILL: British luxury goods founded 1893 by Alfred Dunhill. Tobacco, fashion, fragrances. Sophisticated masculine elegance. Richemont owns. Lighters, leather goods. Reduced tobacco focus. 'The Man's Store' historical slogan.
EXXON: American oil company from Standard Oil breakup 1911. Largest publicly traded oil company. Merged with Mobil 1999. Exxon Valdez spill 1989. Tiger mascot. 'Put a tiger in your tank'. Headquarters Texas. Major supermajor oil corporation.
NAB: National Australia Bank founded 1858. Major Australian bank. Red shield logo. Owns banks in UK. One of 'Big Four' Australian banks. Retail, business banking. Controversies over misconduct. Melbourne headquarters.
WHIRLPOOL: American appliance manufacturer founded 1911. World's largest home appliance maker. Washers, dryers, refrigerators. KitchenAid, Maytag, Amana brands. Michigan headquarters. Founded as Upton Machine. Major white goods producer globally.
MAN: German automotive manufacturer founded 1758. MAN SE. Commercial vehicles: trucks, buses. Volkswagen Group Traton owns. Lion logo. Heavy vehicles. Munich headquarters. Major European commercial vehicle manufacturer.
MCLAREN: British automotive manufacturer founded 1963 by Bruce McLaren. Formula One team. Supercars: F1, P1, 720S. Carbon fiber monocoque pioneers. Woking factory. Racing DNA in road cars. Orange brand color racing. Technology and performance focus.
ERICSSON: Swedish telecommunications founded 1876 by Lars Magnus Ericsson. Mobile network infrastructure. 5G leader. Ericsson Globe arena. Struggled in handsets, exited. Nokia main competitor. Operates globally 180+ countries. Telecom equipment giant.
GAMECUBE: Nintendo video game console released 2001. Cube shape with handle. Mini-discs proprietary. Purple became signature color. Super Smash Bros. Melee popular. Outsold by PS2, Xbox. F-Zero GX, Metroid Prime. Beloved by fans now.
TRAVELERS: American insurance company founded 1853. Red umbrella logo iconic. Property, casualty insurance. Acquired by Citigroup 1998, spun off 2002. Warren Buffett investments. St. Paul Travelers merger 2004. Hartford headquarters. Major P&C insurer.
INTERCONTINENTAL: IHG Hotels & Resorts British hospitality founded 1946. Holiday Inn, Crowne Plaza, Kimpton brands. Operates 6,000+ hotels. Loyalty program. Soft-branded Select hotels. Luxury to budget spectrum. Headquartered UK. Major hotel group.
MALIBU: Coconut rum liqueur created 1978 in Barbados. White rum with coconut. Pernod Ricard owns. Tropical beach association. Sweet, mixable. 21% ABV lower proof. Malibu & pineapple popular. Caribbean-themed packaging.
GAMESPOT: Video game website founded 1996. Reviews, news, gameplay videos. Red logo. Giant Bomb sister site. Fandom (formerly Wikia) owns. Merged with GameFAQs. Influential gaming journalism. Gerstmann controversy 2007.
GORENJE: Slovenian appliance manufacturer founded 1950. Refrigerators, washing machines. Retro designs popular. Acquired by Hisense 2018. Colorful appliances. European brand. Exported globally. Mid-tier home appliances.
NIKON: Japanese optics company founded 1917. Cameras, lenses, microscopes. F-mount system. D-series DSLRs. Z mirrorless. Canon rival. Professional photography. 'I am' campaign. Binoculars, measuring instruments. Imaging products leader.
PFIZER: American pharmaceutical founded 1849 by Charles Pfizer. Blue pill (Viagra). COVID-19 vaccine (Comirnaty). Lipitor blockbuster. Manhattan headquarters. Largest pharma revenue. Animal health Zoetis. mRNA vaccine breakthrough 2020.
UNESCO: United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization founded 1945. World Heritage Sites designation. Education, science, culture promotion. Paris headquarters. 193 member states. 'Building peace' motto. Cultural preservation.
UNICREDIT: Italian banking group founded 1998 from mergers. Operates in 13 European countries. Second-largest European bank. Milan, Munich based. Post-2008 struggles. Pan-European ambitions. Cross-border banking services.
PHOTOSHOP: Image editing software by Adobe released 1988 by Thomas Knoll. Industry standard for photo editing. 'Photoshopped' became verb. Layers, filters revolutionary. Creative Cloud subscription. Ai integration. Dominant graphic design software.
BOSE: American audio equipment founded 1964 by Amar Bose. Noise-cancelling headphones pioneer. Wave radio. QuietComfort series. Home theater. MIT research origins. Premium audio. Privately owned. Direct sales model.
IBIS: French budget hotel chain founded 1974 by Accor. Red logo. Economy positioning. Standardized rooms. Over 1,200 hotels worldwide. Ibis Styles, Budget variants. Affordable business/leisure travel. Major Accor brand.
ITV: Independent Television UK broadcaster founded 1955. Commercial television. Britain's Got Talent, Love Island, Coronation Street. Merger of regional franchises. ITV Hub streaming. Advertising-funded. Major UK free-to-air channel.
OAKLEY: American eyewear and apparel founded 1975 by Jim Jannard. Performance sunglasses. Sports endorsements. Frogskins, Razor Blades models. Luxottica owns since 2007. M Frame tactical. Innovation in lens technology.
STUDENTSKA: Czech chocolate bar brand founded 1970s. Peanut and raisin chocolate. Popular nostalgic Czech confection. Blue packaging. Affordable student snack origin. Orion company produces. Traditional Czech candy.
BATA: Czech-Canadian footwear founded 1894 by Tomáš Baťa. Revolutionary mass production methods. Company towns built. Operates globally 70+ countries. Affordable quality shoes. Family lost control communist era. Major international shoe retailer.
JAWA: Czech motorcycle manufacturer founded 1929. Two-stroke engines distinctive. Popular in Eastern Europe. Racing heritage. Communist-era production continued. CZ merged with. Retro models produced. Classic motorcycle brand.
AVAST: Czech cybersecurity company founded 1988. Free antivirus popular. Orange logo. Merged with AVG 2016. Norton acquired 2022. Over 400 million users. Prague-based. Major consumer security software.
BECHEROVKA: Czech herbal liqueur founded 1807 by Josef Becher. Secret recipe 20+ herbs. Karlovy Vary origins. Green bottles. Digestif traditionally. Pernod Ricard owns. National Czech spirit. 'Carlsbad English Bitter' nickname.
BARUM: Czech tire manufacturer founded 1945. Continental acquired 1993. Budget tire brand. Popular in Central Europe. Polaris, Bravuris lines. Czech manufacturing heritage. Value segment Continental portfolio.
PRECIOSA: Czech crystal manufacturer founded 1948. Crystal beads, chandeliers, jewelry components. Competes with Swarovski. Jablonec heritage. Precision-cut crystals. Fashion industry supplier. Traditional Bohemian glassmaking.
UNIPETROL: Czech petrochemical company founded 1994 privatization. PKN Orlen owns. Refining, petrochemicals. Benzina gas stations. Largest Czech refiner. Kralupy, Litvínov refineries. Major Central European petrochemicals.
STAROPRAMEN: Czech brewery founded 1869 in Prague. Molson Coors owns. Lager beer. Green label. Popular Czech and international. Smíchov district brewery. Traditional Czech brewing. Major export brand.
UFON: Czech mobile virtual network operator. Budget mobile services. Competitive pricing. Operates on O2 network. Youth-oriented marketing. Prepaid focus. Alternative Czech mobile provider.
KOFOLA: Czech soft drink founded 1960s. Cola alternative during communism. Herbal extracts. Less sweet than Coca-Cola. National pride beverage. Bottle, draft versions. Popular Czech, Slovak markets. Nostalgic brand.
TETA: Czech drugstore chain. Personal care, cosmetics, household products. Pink branding. Budget-friendly positioning. Over 200 stores Czech Republic. Competes with dm. Regional drugstore leader.
CT: Česká televize Czech public broadcaster founded 1992. Multiple TV channels. License fee funded. CT1, CT2 main channels. News, entertainment, sports. Public service media. National Czech television.
TATRA: Czech truck manufacturer founded 1850. Backbone chassis distinctive. Heavy-duty trucks. Military vehicles. Dakar Rally competitor. Kopřivnice factory. Historical engineering. Off-road truck specialist.
CEZ: ČEZ Group Czech energy company founded 1992. Largest Czech utility. Nuclear, coal, renewable power. State-controlled. Regional electricity supplier. Temelín nuclear plant. Major Central European energy.
RADEGAST: Czech brewery founded 1970 in Nošovice. Bitter lager style. Owned by Asahi. Popular in Czech Republic. Outdoor, masculine marketing. Green bottles. Regional Czech beer. Strong market presence.
DERMACOL: Czech cosmetics brand founded 1966. Make-up cover foundation famous. High coverage products. Affordable beauty. Distributed in 70+ countries. Film industry origins. Czech beauty brand.
PRAGA: Czech vehicle manufacturer founded 1907. Historic cars, trucks, military vehicles. Racing cars. Communist-era production. Modern supercar revival. Prague origins. Engineering heritage. Boutique performance vehicles.
LENTILKY: Czech candy brand. Chocolate-coated lentil-shaped candies. Colorful sugar shells. Popular Czech confection. Nestlé produces. Similar to M&Ms, Smarties. Sweet childhood favorite.
AGROFERT: Czech conglomerate founded 2003. Andrej Babiš founded. Agriculture, food, chemicals, media. Largest Czech company revenue. Controversial political connections. Diversified holdings. Dominant Czech business.
PZU: Powszechny Zakład Ubezpieczeń Polish insurance founded 1803. State-owned. Largest insurer in Poland. Life, property insurance. Red logo. Operates Central Eastern Europe. National insurance leader.
INGLOT: Polish cosmetics founded 1983 by Wojciech Inglot. Makeup, nail polish. Rainbow logo. Freedom System customizable. Operates 700+ stores globally. Cruelty-free. Polish beauty brand international.
ZUBROWKA: Żubrówka Polish vodka founded 1926. Bison grass flavored. Yellowish tint. Rouch group owns. Traditional Polish spirit. Iconic blade of grass in bottle. Export success.
CROPP: Polish fashion retailer founded 2004. Street, casual wear. LPP operates (Reserved parent). Youth-oriented. Denim focus. Over 300 stores. Central European presence. Urban fashion brand.
POLSAT: Polish commercial television founded 1992. Zygmunt Solorz-Żak owner. Major private broadcaster. News, entertainment, sports. Competes with TVP. Largest private Polish TV. Blue logo.
ZELMER: Polish appliance manufacturer founded 1951. Vacuum cleaners, kitchen appliances. BSH Home Appliances acquired. Popular in Poland. Affordable home products. Regional brand recognition.
MOKATE: Polish food company founded 1990. Instant coffee, cappuccino. Coffee creamers. Gold coffee brand. Family-owned. Distributed in 80+ countries. Budget coffee products.
AMICA: Polish appliance manufacturer founded 1945. Refrigerators, ovens, dishwashers. Affordable white goods. Operates in Europe. Budget-friendly positioning. Wronki-based. Regional appliance maker.
TYMBARK: Polish beverage brand founded 1936. Fruit juices, nectars. Maspex owns. Leading Polish juice brand. Healthy positioning. Available in 50+ countries. Orange juice popular.
TVP: Telewizja Polska Polish public broadcaster founded 1952. State television. Multiple channels. Government-controlled controversial. News, entertainment, culture. National public media.
SOBIESKI: Polish vodka founded 1864. Named after King Jan III Sobieski. Premium rye vodka. Blue and gold branding. Produced by Belvedere SA. Traditional Polish vodka.
APART: Polish jewelry retailer founded 1991. Gold, diamond jewelry. Affordable luxury. Over 200 stores. Wedding rings popular. Polish jewelry market leader. Family-owned.
NETIA: Polish telecommunications founded 1990. Fixed-line, broadband, TV. Cyfrowy Polsat acquired 2021. Alternative operator. Business services focus. Regional Polish telecom.
RESERVED: Polish fashion brand founded 2000 by LPP. Contemporary casual wear. Over 400 stores in 20+ countries. Affordable fashion. Central European expansion. Major LPP brand.
ZYWIEC: Żywiec Polish brewery founded 1856. Heineken owns since 1994. Lager beer. Most popular Polish beer brand. Green label. Żywiec town origins. National beer leader.
TVN: Polish commercial television founded 1997. Warner Bros. Discovery owns. News, entertainment. TVN24 news channel. Competes with Polsat. Press freedom issues. Major Polish network.
